assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
source: Philippine Daily Inquirer; Cebu Daily News; ABS CBN; Rappler; Manila Bulletin
notes: On 16 March 2020, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte announced that the month-long lockdown implemented in Metro Manila since 15 March 2020, as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak, was to be made stricter and also extended to the entire island of Luzon, the country's largest island. The military and police began to immediately implement the stricter and more expansive quarantine rules under the so-called Enhanced Community Quarantine, setting up checkpoints between provinces and prohibiting most forms of domestic land, sea and air travel. Classes, most government work and most private work were suspended, social distancing measures were implemented, and most people were instructed to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 1 April 2020, Duterte announced that the military and police are authorized to shoot those who violate lockdown measures and challenge law enforcement officials. The Philippine National Police later downplayed the president's remarks and said they would not immediately shoot quarantine violators. On 7 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine over Luzon would be extended to 30 April 2020. On 24 April 2020, the president announced that the Luzon-wide Enhanced Community Quarantine would be partially lifted by 30 April, but would be extended to 15 May in the following areas in Luzon (subject to possible changes): Metro Manila, Benguet, Pangasinan, Bataan, Bulacan, Nueva Ecija, Pampanga, Tarlac, Zambales, Batangas, Laguna, Cavite, Rizal, Quezon, Albay, Oriental Mindoro, Occidental Mindoro, and Catanduanes.
In March 2020, about 2000 individuals were arrested by the police across Cebu, for purportedly violating measures put in place amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 12 March 2020, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte announced the month-long lockdown of Metro Manila in response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak, to begin 15 March 2020. Duterte ordered the military and police to implement to lockdown by setting up checkpoints at entry points to Metro Manila, with entry and exit being tightly regulated and most forms of domestic land, sea and air travel to the National Capital Region banned. Authorities would later also announce a 8 PM-5 AM curfew. Classes and most government work were also suspended and social distancing measures implemented. Some quarters condemned the measures as excessive and overly militaristic.

On 15 March 2020, NPA militants and government soldiers engaged in a 20-minute firefight in Barangay San Vicente Kanluran, Catanauan, Quezon. The military said it overran an NPA camp at the area and retrieved weapons and other items from the rebels. There were no reported casualties on either side.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 16 March 2020, local authorities started imposing a month long quarantine over Antique and Capiz province, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 20 March 2020, local authorities announced a quarantine over Iloilo province, effective from 20 March to 14 April 2020. Similar measures were implemented in Negros Occidental on 30 March, and on Negros Oriental on 3 April. On 24 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine would be extended to 15 May in the following areas in Western Visayas (subject to possible changes): Antique and Iloilo. On 30 April 2020, the Negros Occidental provincial government downgraded the quarantine measures, while the Bacolod City government extended the Enhanced Community Quarantine in the city to 15 May.

On 16 March 2020, a police officer was seriously wounded by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Canlubang, Calamba, Laguna. The motive for the attack was unclear. A nearby truck driver was also wounded by a stray bullet.

The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 24 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine would be extended to 15 May in the following areas in the Davao Region (subject to possible changes): Davao City, Davao del Norte, and Davao de Oro.

On 16 March 2020, NPA militants and government soldiers engaged in a 10-minute firefight in Barangay Binolosan Pequeno, Calinog, Iloilo. The military said some rebels were wounded. The military also reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels.

notes: Starting 16 March 2020, local authorities implemented a month-long quarantine over Cotabato province, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement a modified, less strict quarantine across the province, but stricter controls were put in place in the capital Kidapawan, which was put in lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine).

The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law.

On 16 March 2020, a soldier survived an attack by assailants at his home in Barangay Duran, Balatan, Camarines Sur. Authorities know the identities of the assailants but the motive for the attack was unclear. The soldier was at home having a drink with friends and is assumed off-duty.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: As of 16 March 2020, local authorities have imposed a month-long quarantine over Bohol and Cebu province, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved strict controls on the movement of people, the implementation of social distancing measures, the suspension of classes and most government and private work, and a general instruction on residents to stay in their houses under penalty of law. On 24 April 2020, the national government announced that the Enhanced Community Quarantine would be extended to 15 May in Cebu, confirming an earlier similar announcement from the local government.

On 17 March 2020, a prosecution witness in the 2009 Ampatuan Massacre case survived an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Poblacion, Shariff Aguak, Maguindanao. The Ampatuan Massacre happened in Ampatuan, Maguindanao on 23 November 2009 and involved 58 fatalities. The masterminds of the Ampatuan Massacre - including key members of the politically powerful Ampatuan family - as well as around 40 others were convicted for crimes related to the massacre in December 2019.

On 17 March 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Pulpogan, Consolacion, Cebu. The drug suspect had been released from jail earlier in the year after being detained on drug charges.

On 17 March 2020, a dancer and artistic director of community theater group Bol-anong Artista nga may Diwang Dagohoy (Bansiwag), who was also an activist for peasants' rights and belonged to a farming family, was shot dead by suspected military elements in Barangay Dela Paz, Cortes, Bohol. The victim's colleagues and other activist groups that condemned the killing pinned it on the military, saying that the victim and his family had been red-tagged by the state.

On 17 March 2020, the National Capital Region Police Office (NCRPO), the Philippine National Police (PNP) division with jurisdiction over Metro Manila, announced that it was temporarily suspending its anti-drug operations (the so-called Oplan Tokhang) during the month long Enhanced Community Quarantine over Metro Manila, so that it may focus on its implementation of the quarantine measures as part of the government response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. Location coded at the NCRPO headquarters in Taguig.
On 18 March 2020, NPA militants and government soldiers engaged in a firefight in Mabini, Davao de Oro. There were no reported casualties on either side.

On 19 March 2020, the military recovered two improvised explosive devices (IEDs) planted by suspected NPA rebels in Barangay New Salem, Bayugan, Agusan del Sur, on the first day of the government's unilaterally-declared ceasefire with Communist rebels amid its response to the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
source: ABS CBN; CNN; Bulatlat; Manila Bulletin; Manila Times
notes: On 18 March 2020, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte announced from Manila a unilateral ceasefire with the CPP-NPA-NDF to take effect from 19 March to 15 April 2020, to allow the military and police to focus its efforts on the government response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak, including the implementation of the month long lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) on the entire island of Luzon. The rebels had a lukewarm response to the declaration and asserted that there was no basis to reciprocate, saying that the government declaration was premature and probably insincere and false, but said it would consider the government's appeal to make a similar move. On 17 April 2020, the military announced that it has resumed combat operations and that the government ceasefire will not be extended absent another proclamation from the president, even though the Enhanced Community Quarantine was extended to 30 April 2020 and the Communist Party of the Philippines extended its own unilateral ceasefire to the same date.

assoc_actor_2: Manobo Ethnic Group (Philippines); Lumad Ethnic Group (Philippines)
notes: On 19 March 2020, a Manobo tribal chieftain and another person were killed by suspected NPA militants in Barangay Magroyong, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur. The victims' fellow tribesmen condemned the killings, saying it was because of the tribal chieftain's refusal to help the Communist rebels.

actor2: Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit
notes: On 19 March 2020, suspected NPA militants attacked a patrol base of the military's auxiliary Citizen Armed Force Geographical Unit (CAFGU) in Barangay Sandayaw, Guihulngan, Negros Oriental, engaging the auxiliaries in firefight before retreating. There were no reported casualties on either side.

assoc_actor_1: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-); Military Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 21 March 2020, local authorities announced a quarantine over Iligan, Lanao del Norte, effective from 20 March to 10 April 2020, following the national government's earlier decision to put Metro Manila and later the entire island of Luzon under lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) as a response to the COVID-19 Coronavirus outbreak. The military and police were tasked to implement the quarantine, which involved checkpoints, a prohibition on most forms of domestic land, sea and air travel, and the suspension of classes and most government and private work. Social distancing measures were implemented and most people were instructed to stay in their houses under penalty of law.

On 21 March 2020, suspected NPA militants engaged the military in a 12-minute firefight in Barangay Penaranda, Kabasalan, Zamboanga Sibugay, while the military was reportedly conducting an information campaign on the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic in the said barangay. The NPA militants retreated. There were no reported casualties on either side, though the military reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels. The armed clash happened during the government's unilaterally-declared ceasefire with the communist rebels, effective 19 March to 15 April 2020, amid its response to the pandemic.

On 21 March 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Tangke, Talisay, Cebu. Police said the drug suspect had already been detained on drug charges but was released the previous year after a plea bargaining agreement.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 23 March 2020, a barangay councilor - alleged in an anonymous text to relatives to be a high-value drug suspect - was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants inside his store in Barangay Antipolo, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. The police however considered robbery as the likeliest motive for the attack and said they had no evidence to show that he was indeed a drug suspect.

From 17 to 29 March 2020, 2,521 individuals were arrested across Metro Manila for violations of measures that have been put in place by the government in response to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. 7,627 others were also arrested in other regions of Luzon, while 6,891 in other parts of the country. A Luzon-wide lockdown (Enhanced Community Quarantine) in response to the pandemic has been in effect for at least a month since 16 March 2020. Several other regions followed suit and implemented similar measures.

On 24 March 2020, a drug suspect was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Cabatangan, Talisay, Negros Occidental. The police said the motive for the killing could either be involvement in illegal drugs or in robbery.

assoc_actor_2: Manobo Ethnic Group (Philippines); Lumad Ethnic Group (Philippines)
notes: On 24 March 2020, suspected NPA militants reportedly attacked a Manobo Lumad settlement in Barangay Gupitan, Kapalong, Davao del Norte, before government soldiers arrived to respond and engaged the rebels. Details of the attack on the settlement, including the possible motive, were unclear. There were no reported casualties.

On 24 March 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Conel, General Santos City, South Cotabato. Police said that several grams of shabu (crystal meth) were recovered from the suspect and that he was on the drug watchlist.

On 24 March 2020, NPA militants and government soldiers engaged in two clashes an hour apart in Barangay Gupitan, Kapalong, Davao del Norte. The military said it fired mortar and artillery rounds at the rebels, alongside air support. The military said that the soldiers were deployed in the area, a Manobo Lumad settlement, as a Community Support Team assisting the local government and health authorities in responding to the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic. There were no reported casualties on either side. The armed clash happened during the government's unilaterally-declared ceasefire with the communist rebels, effective 19 March to 15 April 2020, amid its response to the pandemic.

On 24 March 2020, Abu Sayyaf militants and government soldiers engaged in a five-minute firefight in Barangay Bangalan, Indanan, Sulu, after rebels massing up in the area encountered soldiers who were conducting an information campaign on the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic. There were no reported casualties on either side. The clash led to the freeing of a doctor abducted by the Abu Sayyaf in Barangay Walled City, Indanan, Sulu on 3 February 2020.

assoc_actor_1: Government of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 25 March 2020, a former Barangay captain was shot dead by unidentified assailants - including allegedly a currently serving Barangay captain - in Barangay Lingtan, Bangued, Abra. The motive for the killing was unclear.

On 25 March 2020, Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte signed in Manila a bill declaring a state of national emergency and granting him emergency powers, in response to the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic. The signed bill - a watered down version of what was originally proposed by the government prior to lengthy Congressional and Senate debates - gave the president the authority to disburse emergency monetary assistance to families hardest-hit by the pandemic as well as health workers, to reallocate government savings, and to temporarily take over the operation of private medical facilities and transportation. The emergency powers are valid for three months.

actor1: CPP-NPA-NDF: Communist Party of the Philippines-New People's Army-National Democratic Front
assoc_actor_1: NPA: New People's Army
source: Bulatlat; Mindanao Goldstar Daily; Philippine Daily Inquirer
notes: On 26 March 2020, the Communist Party of the Philippines' unilaterally-declared ceasefire with the government took effect after being announced the previous day, and is to be in force until 15 April 2020. The CPP directed the NPA to cease all operations against the military. The CPP said that the ceasefire declaration was a direct response to United Nations Secretary General's call for a global ceasefire between warring parties amid the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) pandemic, and that it is meant to allow unhampered medical and economic assistance efforts. The CPP had earlier refused to reciprocate the government's own unilateral ceasefire declaration, already in effect from 19 March to 15 April 2020. On 15 April 2020, the CPP extended the ceasefire to 30 April 2020.

assoc_actor_2: Drug Suspects (Philippines); Former Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-)
notes: On 26 March 2020, three drug suspects, including a former police officer, were killed during a police raid in Barangay Cannery Site, Polomolok, South Cotabato. Police said that shabu (crystal meth) and weapons were recovered from the suspects, and that the former police officer was dismissed in 2016 for alleged involvement in illegal drugs and was on the drug watchlist.

On 27 March 2020, a group of five suspects harassed a nurse and threw disinfectant (bleach) at his face and body near the public market in President Quirino, Sultan Kudarat, as the nurse was on his way to a hospital to report for duty amid the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. The hospital decried the attack as an example of the discrimination health workers are increasingly facing in the midst of the health crisis. [size=5]

On 27 March 2020, two unidentified assailants harassed a nurse and threw disinfectant (chlorine) at his body while he was walking along Tres de Abril Street in Cebu City, Cebu. The nurse's colleagues at the hospital decried the attack as an example of the discrimination health workers are increasingly facing in the midst of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. [size=2]

On 28 March 2020, an NPA militant and a government soldier were killed during a firefight between the NPA and the military in Barangay Puray, Rodriguez, Rizal. Two soldiers were also wounded during the clash, as well as an undetermined number of rebels, according to the military. The military said it also retrieved weapons and other items.

On 29 March 2020, a police officer was wounded after being shot by armed assailants in Barangay Damawato, Datu Paglas, Maguindanao. The police officer had flagged the group for violating a curfew in place because of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.
On 29 March 2020, a barangay councilor was shot dead by an unidentified assailant in Barangay Sugod, Sorsogon City, Sorsogon. The motive for the attack was unknown.
On 29 March 2020, a drug suspect was killed during a police raid in Barangay Zone 3, Dasmarinas, Cavite.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Philippines)
notes: On 30 March 2020, health workers led by the Alliance of Health Workers (AHW), particularly those from major hospitals in Metro Manila dealing with COVID-19 (coronavirus) cases, participated in an online demonstration from their respective hospitals, holding up placards manifesting their demand for sufficient personal protective equipment (PPE) for all health workers and protection against increasing discrimination. The demonstrators also demanded free testing for COVID-19, increased social spending on health, and other kinds of material support for health workers. [size=no report]

actor2: Police Forces of the Philippines (2016-) Barangay Peace and Security Officer
notes: On 31 March 2020, a drug suspect who was also a village watchman was shot dead in a vigilante-style attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Gustilo, La Paz, Iloilo City, Iloilo. The fatality was manning a COVID-19 (coronavirus) quarantine control point when he was attacked. Police said the fatality had previously surrendered for involvement in illegal drugs.
On 31 March 2020, a barangay councilor was wounded in an attack by unidentified assailants in Barangay Tres Marias, Donsol, Sorsogon. The motive for the killing was unknown.

On 31 March 2020, 29 BIFF militants surrendered to the military at the army camp in Barangay Sapakan, Rajah Buayan, Maguindanao, after intensive military operations against the rebels in the province the previous month. The military said the surrendering rebels wanted to avail of government assistance programs offered to rebels who give up arms.

On 31 March 2020, a suspected NPA militant was killed in a firefight with the military in Barangay Bungahan, Gumaca, Quezon. There were no reported casualties on the government side. The military reported retrieving weapons and other items from the rebels.

On 31 March 2020, a drug suspect who was supposedly running amok and threatening people with a gun was shot dead by a responding police officer in Barangay Tolotolo, Consolacion, Cebu. Police said the drug suspect had previously been arrested on drug charges.

notes: On 31 March 2020, a woman farmer leader and organizer affiliated with a local chapter of KMP was shot dead by suspected military elements in Barangay Patong, San Miguel, Surigao del Sur. KMP and other groups that condemned the killing said that the victim was persistently red-tagged by the military.
